intro: Pilosella bauhini subsp. transgressa, commonly known as the Transgressive Mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white petals. The plant typically grows in alpine and arctic regions, thriving in rocky and dry environments. It has hairy stems and leaves, which help reduce water loss in its harsh habitat. Pilosella bauhini subsp. transgressa is often found in open meadows and is adapted to cold climates.
